section.name: Tests about means
section.page: This exercise asks you to perform a hypothesis test about the mean of a normal population whose standard deviation, σ, is known. The hypotheses must be specified, a z-score evaluated, the p-value found and the conclusion given.
In this exercise, the population standard deviation is unknown, so the test statistic must use the sample standard deviation and the p-value must be looked up from a t distribution.
